questions.text: Can you name any one of the five books of Moses?
questions.explanation:
Genesis & Exodus & Leviticus & Numbers & Deuteronomy.

	They were: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy...the first five books of the Bible, they are also known as the 'Pentateuch'.  It is thought by some that Moses was the author of these books, but this is very likely not true.

questions.text: If you have a very serious conflagration, you might refer to it by which 'five' phrase?
questions.correct: Five-alarm & five alarm & five-alarm fire & five alarm fire
questions.explanation:
Five-alarm & five alarm & five-alarm fire & five alarm fire.

	You can also refer to a hot chili as a 'five-alarm' chili.

questions.text: Your hand has five fingers.  What is the largest in width usually called?
questions.explanation:
Thumb.

	Thumbs up if you got this one correct.  Your thumb may be the largest in width, but it is usually only about as long as your pinkie.

questions.text: This set of quintuplets was born in 1934.  Which names goes with the set?
questions.explanation:
Dionne.

	They are the famous Dionne quintuplets, born in Canada, May 28, 1934.

questions.text: Cayuga, Mohawk, Onandaga, Oneida and Seneca...what Indian federation?
questions.explanation:
Iroquois.

	The Iroquois Nation, League or Federation, if you fancy, became six in 1722, when the Tuscarora joined.  These tribes all spoke related languages of the Iroquois family.  I hope you were able to enjoy this quiz and learn a thing or two...thank you for playing!
